text:
the global usecase.xmap in webapp/lenya/usecases still contains cforms-specific
code that is only used by the cforms usecase. it should be moved into the cforms
module sitemap.
creator: nettings@apache.org

text: Thorsten, do you think that can / should be done?
creator: andreas@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
there is no cforms-specific code in usecase.xmap anymore, so the original issue
is obsolete (i think i even fixed it myself... doh!)
but in global-sitemap.xmap, there are these snippets:

    <!-- ajax -->
    <map:pipeline>
      <map:match pattern="cforms/ajax/**">
        <map:read src="resource://org/apache/cocoon/ajax/resources/{1}"/>
      </map:match>
    </map:pipeline>

    <!-- dojo -->
    <map:pipeline>
      <map:match pattern="cforms/dojo/**">
        <map:read src="resource://org/apache/cocoon/dojo/resources/{1}"/>
      </map:match>
    </map:pipeline>

    <!-- cforms -->
    <map:pipeline>
      <map:match pattern="cforms/forms/**">
        <map:read src="resource://org/apache/cocoon/forms/resources/{1}"/>
      </map:match>
    </map:pipeline>

i think they should eventually be moved into an appropriate module or removed
(are they used at all?)
